DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Combined Medication Treatment Aggression Children With Attention Deficit With Hyperactivity Disorder ( The SPICY Study )
DOC.detailed_description: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder ( ADHD ) common childhood mental disorder affect 3 % 5 % American child . Symptoms ADHD commonly include inability focus exercise normal inhibition , case , aggressive behavior . Approximately 33 % 50 % child ADHD develop oppositional defiant disorder ( ODD ) , 20 % 40 % develop conduct disorder ( CD ) . These disorder characterize defiant , belligerent , otherwise aggressive behavior . Treatment ADHD generally include use stimulant medication decrease impulsivity increase attentiveness , methylphenidate ( Ritalin ) dextroamphetamine ( Dexedrine ) , always affect aggression . To treat aggression ADHD , many physician prescribe additional medication , include mood stabilize medication valproate antipsychotic medication risperidone . There clinical evidence prove use multiple type medication safe effective . This study treat child ADHD aggression combination stimulant antipsychotic mood stabilize medication determine whether aggressive behavior ADHD symptom reduce without harmful side effect . This study two phase . During first phase , last 3 6 week , participant treat normal ADHD stimulant medication . During second phase , whose aggressive behavior effectively suppress stimulant medication alone randomly assign also receive valproate , risperidone , placebo 8 week . After 8 week , child whose aggression persist switch either valproate risperidone risperidone valproate another 8 week . Those placebo switch medication . All participant attend weekly monitoring visit 11 16 week course study . At visit , aggression level medication side effect assess . Families also meet researcher discuss child 's progress attend behavioral counsel therapist .
